channel.title: NPR Morning Edition
channel.description: Morning Edition takes listeners around the country and the world with multi-faceted stories and commentaries every weekday. Hosts Steve Inskeep, Leila Fadel, Michel Martin and A Martínez bring you the latest breaking news and features to prepare you for the day.

item.title: Authorities continue their investigation into the assassination of Charlie Kirk
item.description: In Utah, authorities are trying to piece together the motive in the assassination of Charlie Kirk last week. The suspect is in custody and reportedly not cooperating with law enforcement.

item.title: What's next in the investigation into Charlie Kirk's assassination
item.description: NPR's Michel Martin asks former FBI counterterrorism analyst Javed Ali about the next steps in the investigation into Charlie Kirk's assassination.

item.title: Some Americans worry about threat of political violence after Charlie Kirk's death
item.description: Americans across the country are reacting to Charlie Kirk's death and what his assassination says about the threat of political violence in America.

item.title: Morning news brief
item.description: The latest in the investigation into the murder of Charlie Kirk, Secretary of State Marco Rubio set to hold talks with Netanyahu amid tensions in Middle East, the biggest winners from Sunday's Emmys.

item.title: Millions of Americans expected to lose health coverage over the next decade
item.description: In the Rio Grande Valley of south Texas, 1 in 3 people already lack health insurance. That's expected to get worse as President Trump's spending cuts take effect.

item.title: 'Adolescence,' 'The Pitt' win big at Sunday's Emmys
item.description: From HBO Max's "The Pitt" to CBS' "The Late Show With Stephen Colbert," here's a look at the biggest winners -- and surprises -- from Sunday's Emmys.

item.title: NPR revisits HIV/AIDS patients who lost access to meds after Trump cut foreign aid
item.description: In April 2025, NPR looked at the impact of President Trump's cuts to foreign aid on HIV positive individuals in Zambia. Many were falling sick without access to their HIV medications. We returned to those people, as well as others who keep close tabs on the HIV/AIDS situation, to see where things stand now.

item.title: Secretary of State Marco Rubio to talk with Netanyahu amid tensions in Middle East
item.description: Secretary of State Marco Rubio is in Israel where he'll meet with Prime Minister Netanyahu Monday, as leaders of Arab and Islamic countries also prepare for an emergency summit.

item.title: Arab foreign ministers to meet Monday for emergency summit. Here's what we can expect
item.description: Aaron David Miller, a former State Department Middle East analyst and negotiator, discusses what we might expect from Monday's emergency gathering of Arab leaders in Qatar.

item.title: Officials step up police presence on Charlotte's light rail after fatal stabbing
item.description: Officials in Charlotte, North Carolina, have stepped up security on the city's light rail system after the fatal stabbing of a woman on a train last month.
